page.title: 18Houses
page.content: Of the 1034 houses in the area, only a small proportion of them reflect the origins of the area, these being largely concentrated around the centre of the village of Barwell. Newer developments are concentrated in three main areas: {(i) Council Property.}A substantial post-war estate was built to accomodate the rising population and to home mining families in the area. {(ii)Private Housing.} Considerable estates have been developed since the 1960s to house local workers and commuters. {(iii)Coventry Housing Association.}An expanding estate owned by the Assoc. provides accomodation for a wide variety of groups.
